medical_history.chief_complaint: 3 days of fevers and shaking chills
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient initially presented with left lower quadrant abdominal pain, with symptoms developing into intermittent fevers to 103 degrees Fahrenheit. Symptoms include shaking chills, mild nausea, and episodes of vomiting. Denies cough, dyspnea, and ongoing urinary symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes type 2 with eye manifestations, hypertension, morbid obesity, kidney stones, diabetic retinopathy with diabetic macular edema, colon adenoma
